municipality_name.instruction: Enter the name of the municipality

inter_municipality_name.instruction: Enter the name of the inter-municipality organization

logo.instruction: Provide the URL or path to the municipality logo

population.instruction: Enter the total population of the municipality

area.instruction: Enter the total area of the municipality in square kilometers

data_from_year.instruction: Enter the year from which this data was collected

total_budget.instruction: Enter the total budget of the municipality in euros

total_budget_per_person.instruction: Enter the total budget per person in euros

debt_repayment_capacity.instruction: Enter the debt repayment capacity as a ratio

debt_ratio.instruction: Enter the debt ratio as a percentage

debt_duration.instruction: Enter the debt duration in years

year.instruction: Find 3 important historical milestones concerning the municipality. Order them consecutively. This is the first one. Enter the year of the first historical milestone

milestone.instruction: Find 3 important historical milestones concerning the municipality. Order them consecutively. This is the first one. Describe the first historical milestone event
milestone.example: Création de la Communauté d'Agglomération de Dijon Métropole

year.instruction: Find 3 important historical milestones concerning the municipality. Order them consecutively. This is the second one. Enter the year of the second historical milestone

milestone.instruction: Find 3 important historical milestones concerning the municipality. Order them consecutively. This is the second one. Describe the second historical milestone event
milestone.example: Création de la Communauté d'Agglomération de Dijon Métropole. Création de la Communauté d'Agglomération de Dijon Métropole

year.instruction: Find 3 important historical milestones concerning the municipality. Order them consecutively. This is the third one. Enter the year of the third historical milestone

milestone.instruction: Find 3 important historical milestones concerning the municipality. Order them consecutively. This is the third one. Describe the third historical milestone event
milestone.example: Creation de Dijon Métropole avec 23 communes

historical_milestones.instruction: Find 3 important historical milestones concerning the inter-municipalities. Make sure they are 3 distinct and different events. Take care of this when researching the individual milestones.

theme.instruction: Find 3 important green projects concerning the municipality. This is the first one. Describe the environmental theme of the project

category.instruction: Find 3 important green projects concerning the municipality. This is the first one. Describe the category of the green project

description.instruction: Find 3 important green projects concerning the municipality. This is the first one. Provide a detailed description of the green project
description.example: Deployment of photovoltaic panels on the roofs of public buildings (Anjou and Buffon school groups, Gymnasium, Fontaine d'Ouche stadium, etc.).

theme.instruction: Find 3 important social projects concerning the municipality. This is the first one. Describe the social theme of the project

category.instruction: Find 3 important social projects concerning the municipality. This is the first one. Describe the category of the social project

description.instruction: Find 3 important social projects concerning the municipality. This is the first one. Provide a detailed description of the social project
description.example: Major multiyear renovation plan for Dijon's 76 schools: budget of 75M€ including: 30M€ over 10 years for renovation and modernization, 36.7M€ to remove prefal and 4.3M€ to renovate school grounds and surroundings, e.g. Anjou nursery school (beautificatio of school interiors; Beaumarchais elementary school: renovation of sanitar facilities; Dampierre elementary school: replacement of ground-floor woodwork; Flammarion gymnasium and ALSH schoo groups: partial interior renovation, installation of roller shutters and roof repairs; Coteaux du Suzon, Plein Air and Ouest elementary school groups: renovation of flat roofs; Darcy school group: renovation of préau...).

theme.instruction: Find 3 important green projects concerning the inter-municipality. This is the first one. Describe the environmental theme of the project

category.instruction: Find 3 important green projects concerning the inter-municipality. This is the first one. Describe the category of the green project
category.example: Collection and sorting of household and similar waste (HHW) and treatment of household and similar waste (DMA)

description.instruction: Find 3 important green projects concerning the inter-municipality. This is the first one. Provide a detailed description of the green project
description.example:
Acquisition of household waste skips, upgrading of sorting center PPI of €21 M
Deployment of the hydrogen production and distribution station with the 1st refuse collection vehicle + start-up of operations at the North station (Valmy)
Modernization of the sorting center (€2 million in 2024 and a PPI total of €29 million).
Project to modernize the waste-to-energy plant.

name.instruction: Enter the full name of the contact person

title.instruction: Enter the professional title of the contact person

title_since.instruction: Enter the date when the person started in this title

birth_date.instruction: Enter the birth date of the contact person

birth_place.instruction: Enter the birth place of the contact person

education.instruction: List the educational background of the contact person
example: Master's degree in public law and sports management from the University of Burgundy (1999)
Bachelor's degree in public administration, Université Paris I Panthéon-Assas (2005)
Institute for Public Management and Economic Development (IGPDE) (2006)

activities.instruction: List the professional activities of the contact person
example: 1st Vice-President of Dijon Métropole in charge of soft mobility, the bicycle plan, the European Green Capital, relations with the Département (since September 2024)

career.instruction: List the career history of the contact person
example: Former French champion in 5,000 m canoe-kayak (1998)
Deputy mayor of Dijon, responsible for trade, crafts and the Cour de ville project, then local democracy (2008-2014)
Lecturer in Master 2 at the Faculty of Sports, University of Burgundy (2010-2014)
1st Deputy Mayor of Dijon, responsible for ecological transition, climate and the environment (2014-2024)
Acting Mayor of Dijon (July 27-August 10, 2015)

name.instruction: Enter the full name of the contact person

title.instruction: Enter the professional title of the contact person
title.example: Chairman of the Dijon Metropolitan Council

title_since.instruction: Enter the date when the person started in this title

birth_date.instruction: Enter the birth date of the contact person

birth_place.instruction: Enter the birth place of the contact person

education.instruction: List the educational background of the contact person
example: Master's degree in public law
DESS in Economics
DEA in Political Science

activities.instruction: List the professional activities of the contact person
example: Chairman, CNER (Fédération des agences d'attractivité, de développement et d'innovation) (since May 2023)

career.instruction: List the career history of the contact person
example: Chargé de mission to the prefect of the Burgundy region (1979-1981)
Chargé de mission in the office of Pierre Joxe, then chief of staff to André Billardon, Chairman of the Burgundy Regional Council (1981-1984)
Chief of Staff to Pierre Joxe, Minister of the Interior and Decentralization (1984-1986)
General Delegate of the Association of Progressive and Socialist Regional Councils (1986-1988)
Technical advisor to Pierre Joxe, Minister of the Interior (1988-1991)
Dijon city councillor (1989-2001)
Deputy Chief of Staff to Laurent Fabius (1991-1992) and Henri Emmanuelli (1992-1993), Presidents of the French National Assembly
Sous-préfet hors-cadre on secondment, project manager at the Fondation Jean-Jaurès (1993-1999)
Burgundy regional councillor (1994-2001)
PS National Secretary, in charge of organization and coordination (1997-2005)
Member of the PS national office
General Councillor for Côte-d'Or, Dijon 5 canton (1998-2008)
Technical advisor to Jean-Jack Queyranne, Minister for Relations with Parliament (2000-2001)
Chairman, Dijon Regional Council (2001-2014)
Mayor of Dijon (2001-2014)
Vice-Chairman, AMF (Association des maires de France)
Chairman of the Côte-d'Or Mayors Association (2001-2014)
PS National Secretary, in charge of coordination (2005-2008)
Senator for Côte-d'Or (2008-2014)
Chairman of the Socialist Group in the French Senate (2011-2014)

Minister of Labor, Employment and Social Dialogue in Manuel Valls' first government (April 2014 to August 2014), then Minister of Labor, Employment, Vocational Training and Social Dialogue (August 2014 to August 2015)
Chairman of the Communauté d'agglomération, then the Communauté urbaine du Grand Dijon (August 2014-2017)
Mayor of Dijon (2015-Nov. 2024)
Chairman, FNSER (Fédération nationale des élus socialistes et républicains) (March 2016-Sept. 2021)
